results.title: Dreams come true: interviews with Glen Keane and Lella Smith
results.brief_description: ACMI curator, Emma McRae interviews Glen Keane and Lella Smith as part of the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition at ACMI. Glen Keane is an animator for Disney and has created some of the recent best-loved characters such as Ariel from ‘The Little mermaid’ and ‘The Beast’ from ‘Beauty and the beast’. Lella Smith is the creative director of Disney’s Animation Research Library and was a curator for the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition. These interviews were recorded at ACMI in conjunction with the opening of the exhibition.

results.title: Lella Smith interview with Emma McRae [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.

results.title: Glen Keane interview with Emma McRae [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as: ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Glen about his never-ending passion for drawing, what inspires him to create such unforgettable characters as The Beast and Ariel. Glen also talks about the changes in animation from hand drawn to digital.

results.title: Journeys into the unknown : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Eight members of the community tell their stories of living with HIV. With a fierce zest for life and adventure, they tell of how their lives have changed but also of how they have fought back against the disease and look forward to the journey ahead.

results.title: The Drought : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten farmers from the north-eastern region of Victoria reflect upon their lives within the context of one of the longest and most severe droughts the region has ever seen. In doing so, they highlight the things that have kept them there, whether it be family, community or the love of farming.

results.title: Arthur and Corinne Cantrill interview with Fiona Trigg [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill have been making films together since 1960. Initially focusing on documentaries about art they moved on to experimental film in 1969. From 1971 to 2000 they edited and published Cantrills Filmnotes, a journal on film and video art. Their film work and publishing are well-known internationally and have been represented in several film collections.

In this interview with Fiona Trigg, ACMI Exhibitions Assistant Curator, Arthur and Corinne talk about their early days of expanded cinema and their technical and creative processes.

results.title: 'At the movies': Tim Burton masterclass with Margaret Pomeranz
results.brief_description: Hosted by Margaret Pomeranz, this masterclass reveals the workings behind Tim Burton’s creative genius, offering insight into his creative process with a rare view into his world of melancholic misfits, gothic suburbia and contemporary fairytales.
results.title_for_label: ‘At the movies’: Tim Burton masterclass with Margaret Pomeranz

results.title: Train the trainer : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten stories from the general public that were compiled and produced as part of the Digital Storytelling ‘Train the Trainer’ program at ACMI. The stories are mostly biographical, usually centred around an memorable or life-changing event, or dedicated to someone the participants find inspirational.

results.title: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: The East Reservoir Neighbourhood Renewal was set up in 2006 when the area was identified as being in need and enabling residents to help create a community action plan. Part of this process has been to invite seven members of the community to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop to tell very personal stories the reflect life in the suburb.

results.title: Fire Woman and Tristan's Ascension: Bill Viola installation and interviews
results.brief_description:
This film captures the installation of the large projection screen and associated audio visual equipment needed to showcase Bill Viola’s works, ‘Fire Woman’ & ‘Tristan’s Ascension’. The exhibition took place at St Carthage’s Catholic Church in Parkville and the film features a short introduction by John Kaldor and interviews with Bill Viola and Father Michael Elligate.

Bill Viola has been instrumental in the establishment of video as a vital form of contemporary art. For over 40 years he has created videotapes, architectural video installations, sound environments, electronic music performances, flat panel video pieces and works for television broadcast. His video installations, total environments that envelop the viewer in image and sound, employ state-of-the-art technologies and are distinguished by their precision and direct simplicity.
